Issues.Title: Ivy LS: support autocompletion within templates
Issues.Body:
**Status**: blocked on TemplateTypeChecker implementation of required operations.

Objective 4 for the Ivy LS project is to support autocompletion within templates and template expressions. This is significantly more challenging than the other objectives as it requires processing of "incomplete" expressions within the template, as well as interpretation of cursor positions within those expressions. Additionally, the existing type check block format may not be sufficient for such completion operations, and will likely require augmentation.

There are several kinds of autocompletion operations that need to be supported:

* completing a top-level identifier (which is a reference to a complex namespace involving local template variables as well as component properties)
* completing an element name or attribute
* completing within an expression

It's also unclear from a design standpoint how the responsibility should be split between the compiler and LS codebases for this feature.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: support autocompletion within templates" (#38067)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: support go to definition on symbols within a template
Issues.Body:
**Status**: blocked on TemplateTypeChecker implementation of required information.

Objective 3 for the Ivy LS project is to support go-to-definition on expressions and symbols within a template, using information derived from the compiler's `TemplateTypeChecker`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: support go to definition on symbols within a template" (#38066)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: show hover tooltip on expressions, bindings, and other nodes within a template
Issues.Body:
**Status**: blocked on `TemplateTypeChecker` implementation of required information.

Objective 2 for the Ivy LS project is to show hover tooltips on nodes within the template, using information derived from the compiler's `TemplateTypeChecker`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: show hover tooltip on expressions, bindings, and other nodes within a template" (#38065)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: Get `ts.Symbol` from `AST` nodes in a template.
Issues.Body: Add `TemplateTypeChecker` operations to retrieve the `ts.Symbol` of an `AST` expression from a template. Some creative interpretation might be required to determine what constitutes the symbol of various kinds of expressions. Not all expressions will have symbols (e.g. there is no symbol associated with the expression `a + b`, but there are symbols for both the `a` and `b` nodes individually).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: Get `ts.Symbol` from `AST` nodes in a template." (#38064)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: `TemplateTypeChecker` operation to get `ts.Symbol` for input
Issues.Body: Add a `TemplateTypeChecker` operation to retrieve a `ts.Symbol` given a pointer to an input binding within the template AST. This can potentially be resolved without referring to the TCB.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: `TemplateTypeChecker` operation to get `ts.Symbol` for input" (#38063)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: rapid diagnostics for external template changes
Issues.Body:
**Status**: blocked by #38059, #38058, #38060

Objective 1 for the Ivy LS project is to show template type-checking diagnostics as the user edits a template. Building on the work to build a low latency update mechanism for template diagnostics, and integrate the template type-checking engine with the language service model for `ts.Program` updates, we should be able to implement near-realtime `ts.Diagnostic`s as users edit external templates.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: rapid diagnostics for external template changes" (#38061)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: implement a `TypeCheckingProgramStrategy` for the language service
Issues.Body:
The compiler exposes a `TypeCheckingProgramStrategy` interface that abstracts how the template type-checking engine can obtain a `ts.Program` with updated template type-checking code. The implementation utilized by `ngc` uses an incremental `ts.Program` creation operation, which is suitable for the command-line compiler and `ng.Program` API, but not for the language service.

The language service has its own mechanisms for creating and updating `ts.Program`s, and thus needs its own implementation of a program strategy.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: implement a `TypeCheckingProgramStrategy` for the language service" (#38060)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: support `TypeCheckingProgramStrategy` impls that can't handle inlining
Issues.Body: It is unlikely that the `TypeCheckingProgramStrategy` implemented in the language service will be able to support inlining of template type-checking code. The compiler needs to support implementations of a program strategy which can't handle inlining, and instead produce type-checking diagnostics when inlining would be required for a given component.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: support `TypeCheckingProgramStrategy` impls that can't handle inlining" (#38059)

Issues.Title: Ivy LS: fast round trip for template changes
Issues.Body:
Currently, the Ivy Language Service must perform an incremental build operation when the user changes a component template. This creates a new `ts.Program` for the application, and performs a lot of work to discover that nothing but a component template has changed. This operation is on the order of hundreds of milliseconds, even in the optimal case.

The compiler should instead support type-checking operations in an existing compilation (e.g. an `NgCompiler`) with an overridden template, without needing a full incremental step.

Combined with a language service `TypeCheckingProgramStrategy` that can quickly respond to single-file type-checking updates, this should enable a much lower latency of operations while the user is editing a template.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy LS: fast round trip for template changes" (#38058)

Issues.Title: ng modules
Issues.Body:
# 🚀 feature request

### Relevant Package
ngModule
 


### Description
 The ngModule class closely resembles the Javascript module system (import and export statements),  but does not operate in the same manner.  Indeed if one want to set up an index.ts, using only the export * from './componentName we can now decrease the line by line fullpath components.

[This article](https://dev.to/jwp/a-module-s-implied-index-ts-file-5016) shows the impact of using the index.ts system..  

### Describe the solution you'd like

Any Angular Compile should be able to discover anything it needs to compile based only on decorators. Additionally the exports section should contribute somehow to the Javascript module system.  As it is now there's duplication of effort when in fact there should not be any duplication. 

Can't the build itself generate it's own index files based on a configuration setting?  That way we'd only need to focus on the ngModule system.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
 
1) The compile based on a configuration setting could output the index.ts files.
2) Somehow the ngModule exports statements double as an index.ts type export.
3) Do away with the ngModule class and let the compiler discover all the content needed to compile using the namespace concept just like .NET does.  Imports are single line in .NET but they are implicit to the build, intellisense finds the folders automatically without any index concept.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng modules" (#38056)

Issues.Title: feat(compiler-cli): support getting resource dependencies for a source file
Issues.Body:
The compiler maintains an internal dependency graph of all resource
dependencies for application source files. This information can be useful
for tools that integrate the compiler and need to support file watching.
This change adds a `getResourceDependencies` method to the
`NgCompiler` class that allows compiler integrations to access resource
dependencies of files within the compilation.

This will be used within the CLI's webpack plugin to optimize the dependency discovery process.
Currently within the CLI, the AST for each source file is manually analyzed which results in a large amount of duplication with the compiler.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(compiler-cli): support getting resource dependencies for a source file" (#38048)

Issues.Title: docs: fix live examples in testing guides
Issues.Body:
In #37957, parts of the testing guide were broken out into separate guides. As part of that work, the `<live-example>` tags were also copied to the new guides. These `<live-example>` tags did not specify the targeted example project via the `name` attribute, thus they were implicitly targeting the example with the same name as the guide they were in. See the [Docs style guide][1] for more info.

However, there is only one example project (`testing/`) and all `<live-example>` tags were supposed to target that. This worked fine on the `testing.md` guide, but it broke on other guides (which tried to target non-existing example projects based on their names).

This commit fixes it by explicitly specifying which example is targeted by the `<live-example>` tags. It also removes the `embedded-style` attribute that has no effect.

Fixes #38036.

[1]: https://angular.io/guide/docs-style-guide#live-examples
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "docs: fix live examples in testing guides" (#38038)

- [ x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

Issue Number: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/37847


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x ] No


## Other information

This PR fixes the issue of hidden icons in IE11

The issue was that there was not enough spacing for the icons-container in IE.

Added right container of the tool bar to contain the search bar + icons container
 gave `flew-grow:1` to search input to take the empty space.

This also fixes that in mobile the icons is truncated
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15147809/87434068-b228d780-c5f2-11ea-9f71-3e52691be157.png)


There is still an issue that the Github svg is not shown in IE, its because the svg of gitHub itself somehow can't be rendered by IE.

This is how it looks like now in IE:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15147809/87440441-a6411380-c5fa-11ea-8286-c3b41fab0082.png)
 There is space for gitHub svg but its not rendered
I would be glad if someone can provide updated Github svg

Issues.Title: OnDestroy override issue - Angular 9+
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package **@angular/core** ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: **Angular 8** ### Description Consider a @Component what implements OnDestroy, on the **constructor** there is a case I must set the following code: **this.OnDestroy = ()=>{ alert('Invoke'); }** On Angular 8, **it use to work**, but somehow in Angular 9 (maybe its IVE issue) that not entering to the override func, instead it entering to the initial implemented func. Can you explain why and if it really a bug? ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.901.6
@angular-devkit/core         9.1.6
@angular-devkit/schematics   9.1.6
@schematics/angular          9.1.6
@schematics/update           0.901.6
rxjs                         6.5.4

Issues.Title: Scss includePaths does not take precedent over node_modules when resolving @imports and causes error
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package @angular-devkit/build-angular ### Is this a regression? I don't know ### Description When using `includePaths` with scss, if an scss file has the same name as a node module, the node_module is resolved which results in the scss file not being found like I would expect and causes an error. I would expect the `includePaths` to take precedent In other webpacks of mine this is solved by modifying the resolve setting of the scss rule ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/jdt3969/angular-scss-include-paths/commit/118d872b85a9d5bdbb3670d75353ecec39d84710 Toggle `@import` to remove and add error https://github.com/jdt3969/angular-scss-include-paths/blob/master/src/app/app.component.scss ## 🔥 Exception or Error Error with dart sass: 

ERROR in Module build failed (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js):
SassError: Can't find stylesheet to import.
  ╷
1 │ @import 'colors';
  │         ^^^^^^^^
  ╵
  /Users/josh/dev/style-test/src/app/app.component.scss 1:9  root stylesheet
Error with node sass: 

ERROR in Module build failed (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js):
SassError: Invalid CSS after "v": expected 1 selector or at-rule, was "var colors = requir"
        on line 1 of node_modules/colors/lib/index.js
        from line 1 of /Users/josh/dev/style-test/src/app/app.component.scss
>> var colors = require('./colors');

Issues.Title: Subresource Integrity for lazy modules is broken when DL is enabled and built twice
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? No ### Description Essentially https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/15468 but when it's built and served twice. Not entirely certain this is an Angular CLI issue or something else. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction ``` ng new lazy-loading-dl --routing cd lazy-loading-dl ng g m foo --module app.module --route foo ``` Add the below in app.component.html ``` link to foo ``` Modify .browserslistrc to: ``` IE 9-10 # Angular support for IE 9-10 has been deprecated and will be removed as of Angular v11. To opt-in, remove the 'not' prefix on this line. IE 11 # Angular supports IE 11 only as an opt-in. To opt-in, remove the 'not' prefix on this line. ``` ``` ng build --prod --subresourceIntegrity http-server dist/lazy-loading-dl ``` Open browser and click on the link It actually works fine now. Issues.Title: [9.1.x] test: move app-shell tests to flake jail
Issues.Body:
App-shell builder imports zone.js, which patches the global promises. In some cases this will causes flakiness in tests that run after this one.

With this change we move the app-shell tests to the flake jail and force them to be run at the very last.

Successful runs when disabling app-shell tests from test-large
https://circleci.com/workflow-run/4afb40f2-19ec-46ab-bb94-4153d448e6ad

(cherry picked from commit 7cb470f32ea6fffdb8915a2948abb355101e927f)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[9.1.x] test: move app-shell tests to flake jail" (#18252)

Issues.Title: Export Schematics util functions and make the available for public
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🚀 Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
- None of the above ones: Schematics

### Description
When authoring an Angular CLI schematics, there are some very common things that will be implemented by almost every schematic new as there are no common public functions available.
A quick [search on NPM](https://www.npmjs.com/search?q=schematic%20utils) leads to many community project results.
However as the Angular CLI itself uses the schematics and common utils, which are already tested and well defined, they should be available for the public.

For example the package [`@ockilson/schematic-utils`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@ockilson/schematics-utils#dependencies) implements the same (or almost the same) functions as already available in the [Angular CLI repo](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/schematics/angular/utility/dependencies.ts)

To prevent some common pitfalls such functions and code duplications such common functions should be exported by `@angular-devkit/schematics`.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Export all functions from [packages/schematics/angular/utility](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/tree/master/packages/schematics/angular/utility) to be available for other schematics.
I think they should be exported via `@angular-devkit/schematics` or as `@angular-devkit/schematics/utils`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Export Schematics util functions and make the available for public" (#18250)

Issues.Title: Speed up angular library build
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🚀 Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ✍️edit: -->
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

`ng build some-lib --watch` will rebuild the whole program every time there is a modification. 
And our library is very large, every time you change a line of ts and save it, it will take a long time to recompile.


### Describe the solution you'd like

I think that when ng build --watch, it is not necessary to perform the operation of packing fesm and umd.
Every time we change a line of css or a line of js, it only updates a single js file of esm2015. Compiling a single file should not take a long time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Speed up angular library build" (#18246)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): wrap ES5 differential loading bundles
Issues.Body:
This change ensures that classic (ES5) script's top-level function helpers do not get overwritten by other scripts top-level functions that happen to have the same name.  This is not an issue when using module script types because each module has its own scope.

Closes https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/36521

Issues.Title: Symlinked scss not triggering recompile on change
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command - [ ] new - [x] build (with --watch) - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description Imagine the following filesystem structure: 
testFolder/
├── realFolder1/
│   └── style1.scss
├── realFolder2/
│   └── style2.scss
└── ngApp/
    ├── src/
    │   ├── styles.scss
    │   ├── link1
    │   └── link2
    └── .....
link1 & link2 are symbolic links, linking to realFolder1 and realFolder2, respectively. The styles.scss in the actual angular app imports the style1.scss from the linked folder link1. The style1.scss imports the style2.scss from the linked folder link2. styles.scss contains actual style definitions. Now when serving (or building with --watch) everything gets compiled correctly, but changes to the styles2.scss are ignored and not rebuild. Only when triggering a change in a different file the changes from style2.scss are *sometimes* also recompiled. Actually in my repro app this is even true for changes to style1.scss! However, on my "real" project where I discovered this, the issue only occurs on the second level of symlinked references... ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction To reproduce this issue you can do the following: Either you recreate the above structure or you clone [my example app](https://github.com/LoaderB0T/scssSymlinkWatchBug) for this issue. In this example app for whatever reason symlinked scss files, do not trigger a recompile at all. In the real app this definitely works on some occasions where it is just one symlinked file, but fails when configured as above. ## 🌍 Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 10.0.2
Node: 12.18.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 10.0.3
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: bug(mat-selection-list): mat-selection-list returns empty list when options are selected programmatically and not touched anything
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-tctdo3?file=src%2Fapp%2Flist-selection-example.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to StackBlitz link and click on submit button, selected values are not shown
2. Select/Change anything on the list and submit again, selected values are shown
 
 
#### Expected Behavior
Selected values should show without user clicking on anything

#### Actual Behavior

Issues.Title: feat(cdk-experimental/menu): add functionality to navigate a Menu and MenuBar with a keyboard
Issues.Body:
The aria spec for Menu and MenuBar describes a robust set of instructions for navigating the Menu
using a keyboard. This implements the full aria spec for vertical and horizontal Menus along with
support for left-to-right and right-to-left layouts. Some liberty is taken with handling keyboard
events with modifier keys (home/end and escape) in order to match the existing mat-menu
implementation for those keys.

Issues.Title: fix(datepicker): not updating calendar state if input changes while open
Issues.Body:
The datepicker was only updating the calendar state that depends on the input when we open and close. I've reworked it so we do it any time one of the input's inputs changes. I also renamed the various `_disabledChange` streams to `_stateChanges` which aligns with what we're doing in other components.

Fixes #19959.

Issues.Title: fix(select): indicating programmatic value change as user interaction in some cases
Issues.Body:
We were using `ListKeyManager.setActiveItem` to change the active item when a value is assigned through a `FormControl`, in order to have it be highlighted if the user opens the panel. The problem is that `setActiveItem` emits a change event as if it's coming from the user, causing us to dispatch an event object with `isUserInput: true`.

These changes use `updateActiveItem` instead which only updates the item, but doesn't emit any events.

Fixes #19967.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(select): indicating programmatic value change as user interaction in some cases" (#19970)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-date-range-picker): updating form control value causes `(dateChanged)` to emit
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-pmxj3r

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the StackBlitz
2. The component is listening for the `(dateChange)` event on the `MatStartDate` directive, and will invoke the `onStartDateChange` method
3. The component is listening for the `(dateChange)` event on the `MatEndDate` directive, and will invoke the `onEndDateChange` method
4. The `range` form control value is updated with a date range. The `(dateChange)` event then fires on both the `MatStartDate` and `MatEndDate` directives.
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?

Nothing should be logged to the console. Consistent with how other angular material components work I would not expect `(dateChange)` to emit if the value of the form control is programatically updated.


#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?

The following was logged to the console:
```
MatEndDate (dateChange) emitted
MatStartDate (dateChange) emitted
```


#### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material: 10.0.1
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):

Issues.Title: feat(cdk/collections): extract view repeater strategies
Issues.Body:
A `ViewRepeater` implements a strategy for rendering a list of elements inside a common `ViewContainerRef`. It encapsulates all the business logic pertaining to inserting, moving, and deleting embedded views. This PR extracts existing strategies from `virtualForOf` and the CDK table, so we can reuse them in upcoming virtual scroll work.


### Summary
* Extracts view repeater strategies from `virtualForOf` and CDK table.
* Refactors `virtualForOf` and CDK table to use the strategies.
* With the exception of extracting the view repeater strategies, no behavior has changed.

For now, this API will be internal until we've tested it with enough components to know it's stable.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(cdk/collections): extract view repeater strategies" (#19964)

Issues.Title: fix(material/core): allow theme overriding for background and foreground
Issues.Body:
Fixes #19935 

With the new color map it's quite verbose to override background/foreground in a custom theme.
This pull request attempts to solve that by allowing the following to override any background/foreground properties.

```sass
$candy-app-theme: mat-light-theme((
  color: (
    primary: $candy-app-primary,
    accent: $candy-app-accent,
    background: (
      background: #000
    )
  )
));
``` 

Another solution could be `background: if($background != null, $background, $mat-dark-theme-background)` and let the user provide the map_merge on their own as no other property allow partial maps.

```sass
$candy-app-theme: mat-light-theme((
  color: (
    primary: $candy-app-primary,
    accent: $candy-app-accent,
    background: map_merge(
      $mat-dark-theme-background,
      (background: #000)
    )
  )
));
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/core): allow theme overriding for background and foreground" (#19963)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-form-field): mat-error not displayed when form field is in an error state.
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

The Stackllitz app (https://stackblitz.com/edit/yz1dhz-m5re6l) renders two form controls in a form group: 

1. A [mat-select](https://material.angular.io/components/select/overview)
2. A [custom form field control](https://material.angular.io/guide/creating-a-custom-form-field-control) (wraps Codemirror) 

Both form controls are immediately invalid because they are initailized with null and have a required validator. The error message for each form control is displayed in `<mat-error>`.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Select "Foo" from the `<mat-select>` form control to set the corresponding validator on the second form control (the custom form field).
3. The error message for the second form control is correctly displayed `{ "required": true, "message": "Must be Foo" }`.
4. Enter the value "Foo" into the second form control to move the form control to a valid state.
5. The `<mat-hint>` is shown. All good so far :)
6. Select "Bar" from the first form control to set a different validator.
7. The second form control is in an error state and the form field is displayed with a solid red color underline.
8. `<mat-error>` is NOT displayed and the `<mat-hint>` is.
 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1623996/87334183-c3f47700-c52d-11ea-8359-f4e8290d76f2.png)

 
#### Expected Behavior

`<mat-hint>` is hidden and `<mat-error>` is displays `{ "required": true, "message": "Must be Bar" }`

#### Actual Behavior

`<mat-error>` is hidden and `<mat-hint>` is displays `I am a hint.`

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.6
- CDK/Material: 9.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome Version 83.0.4103.116 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): ArchLinux
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-form-field): mat-error not displayed when form field is in an error state." (#19960)
